Systemic symptoms are characteristic and help differentiate influenza from other upper respiratory tract viral illnesses. These include high fever, chills, rigors, headache, myalgias, malaise, and anorexia. Fever and systemic symptoms commonly last for 3 days, however fever can last up to 8 days. Myalgias can be severe and usually involve the back and extremities. Respiratory symptoms include dry cough, sore throat, hoarseness, nasal congestion, and discharge ( 18).
